info.title: This is the EBRAINS KG API
info.description: This is the API of the EBRAINS Knowledge Graph (commit 099480873b4e9f60019f2896ff3b279902b76418).

tags.name: 1 Basic
tags.description: The most used end-points to interact with the EBRAINS KG

tags.name: 2 Advanced
tags.description: Some advanced endpoints allowing you e.g. to apply bulk manipulations and run operations which are going beyond standard meta-data management

tags.name: 3 Admin
tags.description: Endpoints for the administration of the EBRAINS KG. Please note, that you won't be able to invoke those endpoints unless you are a global administrator.

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: By default, the specification is only valid for the current client. If this flag is set to true (and the client/user combination has the permission), the specification is applied for all clients (unless they have defined something by themselves)

delete.description: Allows to deprecate a type specification

put.summary: Assign a type to a space

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space be linked to or "myspace" for your private space

delete.summary: Remove a type in space definition

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space the type shall be removed from or "myspace" for your private space

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space the definition is valid for. Please note that you can't do so for your private space ("myspace")

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space the definition should be removed for. Please note that you can't do so for your private space ("myspace")

put.summary: Trigger a rerun of the events of this space

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space the event rerun shall be executed for.

get.summary: Get the query specification with the given query id in a specific space

put.summary: Create or save a query specification

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: Required only when the instance is created to specify where it should be stored (myspace for your private space) - but not if it's updated.

put.summary: Upload a property specification either globally or for the requesting client

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: By default, the specification is only valid for the current client. If this flag is set to true (and the client/user combination has the permission), the specification is applied for all clients (unless they have defined something by themselves)

delete.summary: Upload a property specification either globally or for the requesting client

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: By default, the specification is only valid for the current client. If this flag is set to true (and the client/user combination has the permission), the specification is applied for all clients (unless they have defined something by themselves)

put.summary: Define a property specification either globally for the requesting client

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: By default, the specification is only valid for the current client. If this flag is set to true (and the client/user combination has the permission), the specification is applied for all clients (unless they have defined something by themselves)

delete.summary: Deprecate a property specification for a specific type either globally or for the requesting client

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: By default, the specification is only valid for the current client. If this flag is set to true (and the client/user combination has the permission), the specification is applied for all clients (unless they have defined something by themselves)

put.summary: Replace contribution to an existing instance

post.summary: Create new instance with a client defined id
post.description:
The invocation of this endpoint causes the ingestion of the payload (if valid) in the KG by using the specified UUID

Please note that any "@id" specified in the payload will be interpreted as an additional identifier and therefore added to the "http://schema.org/identifier" array.

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space name the instance shall be stored in or "myspace" if you want to store it to your private space

minimalistic.description: The most minimal payload you could think of only contains an @type.

with property.description: A payload can contain - next to the @type additional properties.

with link.description: To link to other instances, the JSON-LD notation can be used. Please note that you can use any "@id" or "http://schema.org/identifier" of the targeted resource to link it

patch.summary: Partially update contribution to an existing instance

put.summary: Move an instance to another space

200.description: The instance that has been unreleased

put.summary: Create or update an invitation for the given user to review the given instance

delete.summary: Revoke an invitation for the given user to review the given instance

put.summary: Update invitation scope for this instance

post.summary: Returns the types according to the list of names - either with property information or without

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space by which the types should be filtered or "myspace" for your private space.

post.summary: Triggers the inference of all documents of the given space

get.summary: List the queries and filter them by root type and/or text in the label, name or description

post.summary: Execute the query in the payload (e.g. for execution before saving with the KG QueryBuilder)
Normalizes the passed payload according to the EBRAINS KG conventions

get.summary: Returns a list of instances according to their types

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space of the instances to be listed or "myspace" for your private space

post.summary: Create new instance with a system generated id
post.description:
The invocation of this endpoint causes the ingestion of the payload (if valid) in the KG by assigning a new "@id" to it.

Please note that any "@id" specified in the payload will be interpreted as an additional identifier and therefore added to the "http://schema.org/identifier" array.

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space name the instance shall be stored in or "myspace" if you want to store it to your private space

minimalistic.description: The most minimal payload you could think of only contains an @type.

with property.description: A payload can contain - next to the @type additional properties.

with link.description: To link to other instances, the JSON-LD notation can be used. Please note that you can use any "@id" or "http://schema.org/identifier" of the targeted resource to link it

post.summary: Bulk operation of /instances/{id} to read instances by their UUIDs
Get the release status for multiple instances

200.description: The release status of the instance

post.summary: Read instances by the given list of (external) identifiers

get.summary: Returns suggestions for an instance to be linked by the given property (e.g. for the KG Editor). Please note: This service will return released values for "additionalValue" in case a user only has minimal read rights

parameters.name: sourceType
parameters.description: The source type for which the given property shall be evaluated. If not provided, the API tries to figure out the type by analyzing the type of the root object of the persisted instance. Please note, that this parameter is mandatory for embedded structures.

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description: The target type of the suggestions. If not provided, suggestions of all possible target types will be returned.

post.summary: Returns suggestions for an instance to be linked by the given property (e.g. for the KG Editor) - and takes into account the passed payload (already chosen values, reflection on dependencies between properties - e.g. providing only parcellations for an already chosen brain atlas). Please note: This service will return released values for "additionalValue" in case a user only has minimal read rights

parameters.name: sourceType
parameters.description: The source type for which the given property shall be evaluated. If not provided, the API tries to figure out the type by analyzing the type of the root object originating from the payload. Please note, that this parameter is mandatory for embedded structures.

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description: The target type of the suggestions. If not provided, suggestions of all possible target types will be returned.

get.summary: Retrieve user information from the passed token (including detailed information such as e-mail address)
Retrieve the roles for the current user
Returns the types available - either with property information or without

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space by which the types should be filtered or "myspace" for your private space.

parameters.name: space
parameters.description: The space to be read or "myspace" for your private space

get.summary: Get the endpoint of the configured openid configuration
Execute a stored query to receive the instances
Get the scope for the instance by its KG-internal ID
Get the release status for an instance

200.description: The release status of the instance

get.summary: Get the neighborhood for the instance by its KG-internal ID
List invitations for review for the given instance
Get incoming links for a specific instance (paginated)

Client-Authorization.description: The bearer token for the service account to contextualize the authentication to this client. If you don't know what this is about and just want to test the API, just leave it blank. :)
Client-Authorization.name: Client-Authorization
